title: Marco Antwerpen
text:
Marco Antwerpen (born 5 October 1971) is a German <a href="association%20football">football</a> <a href="manager%20%28football%29">manager</a> and former player who manages <a href="1.%20FC%20Kaiserslautern">1. FC Kaiserslautern</a>, and former player.
Coaching career.
Antwerpen began his coaching career with lower league clubs VfB Günnigfeld and SV Burgsteinfurt. In the 2011–12 season he took over the U19 team of <a href="Rot%20Weiss%20Ahlen">Rot Weiss Ahlen</a>. A year later, he became manager of the first team. After one season, he took a sabbatical, before returning towards the end of the 2013–14 season.
In January 2019 it was announced that Antwerpen and his staff would be leaving <a href="3.%20Liga">3. Liga</a> club <a href="SC%20Preu%C3%9Fen%20M%C3%BCnster">Preußen Münster</a> at the end of the 2018–19 season.
Antwerpen was appointed manager of 3. Liga side <a href="W%C3%BCrzburger%20Kickers">Würzburger Kickers</a> in September 2020. On 9 November 2020, after four losses in the league, he was sacked.
Antwerpen became <a href="1.%20FC%20Kaiserslautern">1. FC Kaiserslautern</a> manager on 1 February 2021.
